input_text:
Job Title: Engineering Manager - Data Engineering

Location: Kansas City Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
More than a mission, C2FO is a movement that is disrupting the financial world and changing the way businesses gain access to the working capital they need to grow. Here, everyone is an employee-owner which means we’re all invested in our work and our team members. We’re a company of team players and self-starters, finding new and innovative ways to get things done. If you’re excited to learn, grow and leave your mark on our fast-growing organization, C2FO may be the place for you.

Headquartered in Kansas City, USA, C2FO has more than 650 employees worldwide, with operations throughout North America, Europe, India, Asia Pacific, and Australia. C2FO is the world’s largest on-demand working capital platform. Our mission is to ensure every business has the capital needed to thrive and we have delivered more than $275 billion in funding to businesses since our founding. How do we do this? By providing fast, flexible and equitable access to low-cost capital through our easy-to-use platform.

We provide technology with a human touch, giving our customers the direct support they need and ensuring our team members have the tools, resources and work environment they need to deliver on our promise to customers. With the C2FO platform, businesses worldwide have more working capital to fuel their growth, create jobs and develop new products.

Responsibilities

The Engineering Manager – Data Engineering is an independent manager of a data engineering team. They are expected to manage team members with different skill sets from their own and communicate expectations clearly to all team members. They will be responsible for technical leadership and mentorship for the engineers who report to them, helping them to improve their technical skills. They are expected to work with stakeholders across C2FO from engineering, product, data science, business intelligence and more to coordinate efforts on projects with wide-reaching impacts on the company. As a technical leader, they must ensure they are tracking the team’s efficiency and quality of deliverables and regularly adjusting processes and timelines to ensure high-quality delivery. In addition to managing data engineers and collaborating with stakeholders across the company, the Data Engineering Manager will also have the final say on technical decisions involving our data warehouse platform. As such, this leader must be highly knowledgeable about the current state of the art in the cloud data warehouse space, including the transition from ETL to ELT, management of cloud data infrastructure, and performance considerations of columnar, MPP data warehouses.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a closely related field.Five years’ progressive experience which must include experience in building and maintaining enterprise-scale ETL (or ELT) pipelines using tools such as SSIS, DBT, or Talend (or similar)Demonstrated knowledge of the following:Data warehousing best practices such as Kimball Methodology or more modern ELT approachesBest practices for maintaining a cloud-based, columnar, MPP database such as Redshift or Snowflake, andSSIS, DBT (Data Build Tool), AWS Redshift (or other MPP data store)

About C2FO

C2FO is the largest non-bank provider of funding to businesses. We’ve also been recognized by Forbes’ Fintech 50 and are on track to become the first financial “unicorn” company in the state of Kansas. Our technology provides hundreds of thousands of business of all sizes (suppliers) an easy, low-cost way to improve cash flow through early invoice payments, while at the same time helping Fortune 500 companies (buyers) achieve far better returns on short-term cash than any other investment vehicle available.

LI-REMOTE

Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we not only value diversity and equality, but we also empower our team members to bring their authentic selves to work every day. Our goal is to create a workplace that reflects the communities we serve and our global, multicultural clients. We recognize the power of inclusion, emphasizing that each team member was chosen for their unique ability to contribute to the overall success of our mission. 

 

We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.summary: An independent manager of a data engineering team responsible for technical leadership, mentorship, and coordination with stakeholders across the company.
preferred_degrees: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a closely related field
required_skills: Building and maintaining enterprise-scale ETL (or ELT) pipelines using tools such as SSIS, DBT, or Talend
Knowledge of data warehousing best practices such as Kimball Methodology or ELT approaches
Knowledge of maintaining a cloud-based, columnar, MPP database such as Redshift or Snowflake
Knowledge of SSIS, DBT, AWS Redshift (or other MPP data store)
job_responsibilities: Managing a data engineering team with diverse skill sets
Providing technical leadership and mentorship to engineers
Coordinating efforts with stakeholders across C2FO
Making final technical decisions on data warehouse platform
Staying updated on cloud data warehouse space
Considering performance of columnar, MPP data warehouses
benefits: Investment in work and team members
Tools and resources for team members
Work environment for delivering on promises
Access to working capital for business growth
Creation of jobs and development of new products
output_json.company_information: C2FO is a global financial technology company headquartered in Kansas City, USA. It provides on-demand working capital solutions to businesses worldwide, aiming to ensure every business has the capital needed to thrive. C2FO has delivered over $275 billion in funding to businesses since its founding. The company offers a platform that enables businesses to improve cash flow through early invoice payments and helps Fortune 500 companies achieve better returns on short-term cash investments.

The company empowers team members to bring their authentic selves to work and aims to create a workplace that reflects the communities it serves and its global, multicultural clients. C2FO does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by applicable law. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.
